showScoreExcerpt:
The people on the dance floor are paying the highest prices in the theatre, and deliberately lose the agency they expected to have. Their experiences are mirroring the oppression of the Filipino populace displayed in the show. High price tickets buy them second class treatment in terms of sight lines, actor interactions, and having to move at a moment's notice. Glitz and glamor are manipulated to make oppression seem fun at first, then scary without warning, then forgotten. Just as in real life.
